page.syntax: URL_Data as P = a5_split_url(C url [,L urlencode ])

argument.name: URL_Data
argument.description: A dot variable containing the following components:

argument.name: url
argument.description: The URL to parse for its components.

argument.name: urlencode
argument.description:
Logical. Default = .F.
.T. = URL encode filename portion of URL.
.F. = do not encode filename portion of URL.

page.description: Splits a URL into its components
page.discussion: The A5_SPLIT_URL() function parses a URL for its components and returns them as elements of a dot variable.
page.example: dim dat as P ?a5_split_url("http://www.foo.com:9999/lala.html") = page = "lala.html" password = "" path = "" port = 9999 protocol = "http" query_string = "" server = "www.foo.com" username = "" dat = a5_split_url("http://myusername:mypass@server1.mydomain.com/folder1/page1.asp?company=Alpha") ? dat = page = "page1.asp" password = "mypass" path = "folder1/" protocol = "http" query_string = "company=Alpha" server = "server1.mydomain.com" username = "myusername" ? a5_split_url("http://msgboard2.alphasoftware.com/alphaphorum/files/200508/d2tw/19/119/before and after images.doc").page = "before and after images.doc" ? a5_split_url("http://msgboard2.alphasoftware.com/alphaphorum/files/200508/d2tw/19/119/before and after images.doc",.t.).page = "before%20and%20after%20images.doc"
